column4: Hi guys, I'm having trouble setting up my ICS, i followed the instruction @ https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Internet/ConnectionSharing using the gateways method. I just want to ask what should my /etc/network/interfaces file look like. this is what i've tried so far:
http://pastebin.com/31QC2iaV
same to you: there's no gateway
address and netmak, ok, but you have to add the gateway address, too
on the client PC and Host?
yes
k, umm wlan0 is on 192.168.1.xxx and eth0 is on 192.168.0.xxx what should the gateway be?
i guess your router, 192.168.0.1 or so
in a terminal, type dig, check the server address
k, just to confirm, that server addr should go into eth0 config for both client and host?
yes, there is only 1 (default) gateway
hmmmm, just restarted the network got and error SIOCADDRT: no such process, failesd to bring up eth0
the gateway ip is 208.xxx.xxx.xxx is that right
do you use a router at home?
shouldn't it be 192.168.0.1
yes, that's what i said earlier
i'm at res, so i dont have access to it
Campus residence
Quickly is shell for Glade / python
retnan: i've created an app (glade and python) but now i'd like to build it into a .deb file.
you're seeing it wrong, quickly uses glade to create python apps, i guess this is what you want: http://www.webupd8.org/2010/01/how-to-create-deb-package-ubuntu-debian.html
